class_notes:
FREN 488W Remakes of History in Francophone Art
Prof. Andrianarivo Rakotobe
MW 9:40-10:55 (online synchronous)
 
Content:  The course examines the literary, artistic, and cultural production of poets, novelists, graphic novelists, filmmakers, and others from the Indian Ocean, the Caribbean, and Sub-Saharan Africa.
Students will reflect on the ways artists from Madagascar, La RÃ©union, Maurice, Martinique, or the RDC quarrel with and refashion knowledge of history in their works. The course will be conducted entirely in French.
Readings:  Texts provided by instructor.
course_description: Courses will include the study of a variety of subjects in French and/or francophone literature and culture. May be repeated for credit.
prerequisites: FREN 310, FREN 314 and two 300 level FREN courses, or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
instructors: Franck Heriniaina Andrianarivo Rakotobe - Primary Instructor
